segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 47
segments.en: Linked Discourses 47

segments.pli: 3. Sīlaṭṭhitivagga
segments.en: 3. Ethics and Duration

segments.pli: 23. Parihānasutta
segments.en: 23. Decline

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca ānando āyasmā ca bhaddo pāṭaliputte viharanti kukkuṭārāme.
segments.en: At one time the venerables Ānanda and Bhadda were staying at Pāṭaliputta, in the Chicken Monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā bhaddo sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā ānandena saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Bhadda came out of retreat, went to Venerable Ānanda, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā bhaddo āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to Ānanda:

segments.pli: “ko nu kho, āvuso ānanda, hetu, ko paccayo yena saddhammaparihānaṃ hoti?
segments.en: “What’s the cause, Reverend Ānanda, what’s the reason why the true teaching declines?

segments.pli: Ko nu kho, āvuso ānanda, hetu, ko paccayo yena saddhammaaparihānaṃ hotī”ti?
segments.en: And what’s the cause, what’s the reason why the true teaching doesn’t decline?”

segments.pli: “Sādhu sādhu, āvuso bhadda.
segments.en: “Good, good, Reverend Bhadda!

segments.pli: Bhaddako kho te, āvuso bhadda, ummaṅgo, bhaddakaṃ paṭibhānaṃ, kalyāṇī paripucchā.
segments.en: Your approach and articulation are excellent, and it’s a good question.

segments.pli: Evañhi tvaṃ, āvuso bhadda, pucchasi:
segments.en: For you asked:

segments.pli: ‘ko nu kho, āvuso ānanda, hetu, ko paccayo yena saddhammaparihānaṃ hoti?
segments.en: ‘What’s the cause, what’s the reason why the true teaching declines?

segments.pli: Ko panāvuso ānanda, hetu, ko paccayo yena saddhammaaparihānaṃ hotī’”ti?
segments.en: And what’s the cause, what’s the reason why the true teaching doesn’t decline?’”

segments.pli: “Evamāvuso”ti.
segments.en: “Yes, reverend.”

segments.pli: “Catunnaṃ kho, āvuso, satipaṭṭhānānaṃ abhāvitattā abahulīkatattā saddhammaparihānaṃ hoti.
segments.en: “It’s because of not developing and cultivating the four kinds of mindfulness meditation that the true teaching declines.

segments.pli: Catunnañca kho, āvuso, satipaṭṭhānānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā saddhammaaparihānaṃ hoti.
segments.en: It’s because of developing and cultivating the four kinds of mindfulness meditation that the true teaching doesn’t decline.

segments.pli: Katamesaṃ catunnaṃ?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ;
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: vedanāsu … pe …
segments.en: They meditate observing an aspect of feelings …

segments.pli: citte … pe …
segments.en: mind …

segments.pli: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, āvuso, catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ abhāvitattā abahulīkatattā saddhammaparihānaṃ hoti.
segments.en: It’s because of not developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that the true teaching declines.

segments.pli: Imesañca kho, āvuso, catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā saddhammaaparihānaṃ hotī”ti.
segments.en: And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that the true teaching doesn’t decline.”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the venerables Ānanda and Bhadda were…

suttaplex.blurb: Venerable Bhadda asks Ānanda about the conditions under which the true teaching declines. Ānanda says it depends on whether the four kinds of mindfulness meditation are practiced.
